item.title: I want to make a starter kit
item.dc:creator: @A.E.M A.E.M.
item.description:
@A.E.M wrote:

add this to your commands

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") && starterKit == 0) { addItem(ITEMID, AMOUNT); sendMessage("You recieved this dumb gift"); starterKit = 1; } else if(starterKit == 1) { sendMessage("LOL N33B"); playerHandler.messageToAll = "Report"+playerName+"for item duping!"; }

then find

if (token.equals("character-height")) { heightLevel = Integer.parseInt(token2);

underneath it add

if (token.equals("character-starterKit")) { starterKit = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then find

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-height = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(heightLevel), 0, Integer.toString(heightLevel).length());

underneath it add

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-starterKit = ", 0, 23); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starterKit), 0, Integer.toString(starterKit).length());

then find

heightLevel = 0;

underneath it add

starterKit = 0;

100% me made myself[br][size=1]Posted on: November 03, 2007, 07:13:19 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Mupescape, post:6, topic:156462”]K will try but something wierd just happened I edited the starter someone else gave me this is what I got

public void starter(){ addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4151, 1); }

if (command.startsWith("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4151, 1); sendMessage("The starter packet for Mupescape v2 players!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !"); }
then when I compiled it this is what it shows

what does “public void fromBank” have to do with anything??[/quote]

add another } to your command or just use my way simpler and uses a saver and tokenz

Read full topic

item.title: I want to make a starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

K will try but something wierd just happened I edited the starter someone else gave me this is what I got

public void starter(){ addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4151, 1); }

if (command.startsWith("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4151, 1); sendMessage("The starter packet for Mupescape v2 players!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !"); }
then when I compiled it this is what it shows

what does “public void fromBank” have to do with anything??

item.title: I want to make a starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

what you mea I need the int?
wait and awww man… I can’t leave the “be sure to thanks mod Mupe”
This is the code you gave me:

if (command.startsWith("starter")) {if (starter == 0) addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4151, 1) sendMessage("The starter packet for "Mupescape v2" players!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !"); } I replaced the server thing as you told me this is right , right?[br][size=1]Posted on: November 03, 2007, 06:12:14 AM[/size][hr]someone reply please besides me

item.title: I want to make a starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Tbh_I_Own Tbh I Own
item.description:
@Tbh_I_Own wrote:

if (command.startsWith("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4151, 1); sendMessage("The starter packet for "Your server name" players!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !"); }

Where i’ve put "your server name"

Replace that with your server name.

Enjoy.

item.title: I want to make a starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

I want to make a starter kit I already made but how do I make it so people can only use it once??
this is my code:

if (command.startsWith("starter")) { addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4151, 1); sendMessage("You have gotten starter kit set set! be sure to thanks Mod Mupe"); }
any one know how to make it work so people can use this command only once?

Read full topic
